head.title: Life Under the Billboard Blanket; Bernstein Restaurant Had Good Source for Pastrami

hedline.hl1: Life Under the Billboard Blanket; Bernstein Restaurant Had Good Source for Pastrami

block.p: I enjoyed your item on Bernstein-on-Essex (''Egg Rolls Fit for a Rabbi,'' F.Y.I., April 16).

The Bernsteins were family friends when I was growing up. Schmulka Bernstein was Sol Bernstein's father, and he owned a butcher shop on Ludlow Street that he and his four sons ran. Sol peeled off to start the deli but I have no doubt that he got the meat from his father that he used to prepare his own corned beef and pastrami.
